conversation.message: Hello School_C Admissions Committee—I'm Student_C. School_C is my first-choice school, and I’m applying because I strongly want to join your community and contribute academically and through school activities. If offered a seat, I will accept and enroll. Thank you for your consideration.
conversation.thought: School_C is my top true choice, so I should apply immediately rather than risk losing the only seat to higher-priority students (Student_A and Student_B) if they apply. An early, clear commitment may help if the school is choosing among multiple applicants in the same round.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_C,

Thank you for your application and for naming School_C as your first choice. We’re pleased to offer you admission to School_C. We appreciate your commitment to enroll if offered a seat, and we look forward to welcoming you to our community.

[ACTION: ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: Student_C applied in round 1. Our true priority is A > B > C > D > E, so Student_C is mid-tier. However, we have no other applicants this round, quota is 1, and accepting now guarantees a filled seat with a student who ranks us #1 (high commitment). Waiting risks ending up with D/E or remaining unfilled if higher-priority students match elsewhere (A prefers B/A; B prefers A then C; A likely goes to B or A; B may go to A). Given the environment and desire to secure a committed match, accept Student_C.
